thread.title: Multiple People Dead After Shooting at Ft. Lauderdale Airport
thread.title_full: Multiple People Dead After Shooting at Ft. Lauderdale Airport

title: Multiple People Dead After Shooting at Ft. Lauderdale Airport
text:
Multiple People Dead After Shooting at Ft. Lauderdale Airport 
The shooter is reportedly in custody . Most Popular By Michael Sebastian Jan 6, 2017 Multiple people are dead and several more injured after a gunman opened fire in the baggage claim area of Fort Lauderdale International Airport on Friday. U.S. Senator Bill Nelson, who represents Florida, told MSNBC that the shooter has been identified as Esteban Santiago, and he had a military ID and a handgun on him. The Broward County Sheriff's Office reported there were five fatalities and eight injured people taken to the hospital. One person was in custody.   
— Broward Sheriff (@browardsheriff) January 6, 2017 Most Popular 
— Broward Sheriff (@browardsheriff) January 6, 2017 No motive has been established in the shooting, which took place in terminal two of the airport. News helicopters hovering over the scene showed hundreds of people standing on the tarmac early Friday afternoon as an ambulance drove by and numerous law enforcement officers rushed to the scene. MORE: One victim at Fort Lauderdale Int'l Airport "bleeding profusely," @CBSMiami reports https://t.co/J54RiABFFl pic.twitter.com/CJPUDGn8K4 
— CBS News (@CBSNews) January 6, 2017 Former White House Press Secretary Ari Fleischer was inside the airport at the time of the shooting and issued some of the first tweets about the incident: I'm at the Ft. Lauderdale Airport. Shots have been fired. Everyone is running. 
— Ari Fleischer (@AriFleischer) January 6, 2017 Fort Lauderdale International Airport is located about 25 miles north of Miami.
